tweet: I'm honored to carry on the dedicated work of women leaders who came before me in getting this amendment ratified. We still need the #ERANow.
Both offer new opportunities to protect women from unfair and unjust discrimination. Though we've made strides, we still need an amendment to enshrine the rights we deserve.

That's why I have signed on to two resolutions -- one that would repeal the expired deadline for the original ERA, and another that creates a modified version of the ERA that explicitly guarantees equal rights for men and women.

The push to ratify the #EqualRightsAmendment (ERA) was a bold effort to expand women's rights across America. But sadly, it wasn't ratified in time by enough states to become law of the land. 37 years after it missed the mark, its protections are still needed.

Great meeting w/ @nfbco members, as well as these two amazing students, Deyannira Villa Cazares of Denver and Ian Lee of Aurora, who are on Capitol Hill today to help increase access to technology for the visually impaired, which is a critical goal for so many fellow Coloradans. pic.twitter.com/IUrNRK1UjC

I’m proud to stand with @HouseDemocrats today as a sponsor of the #PaycheckFairnessAct to ensure men and women receive equal pay for equal work. Progress in achieving this goal is still too slow, and we need to take bold action by passing this bill. pic.twitter.com/k39ubRYADm

We just sent letters to drug makers Eli Lilly, Novo Nordisk and Sanofi, demanding to know why the price of insulin continues to skyrocket. This is a lifesaving drug that millions of Americans rely on – we can’t let its cost put it out of reach.    https://bit.ly/2HDLdtO  pic.twitter.com/dahEkrcHFp

It’s been 10 years since Pres. Obama signed the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act into law. It was a monumental step towards ensuring equal pay, but we still have a lot of work to do. I’m proud to continue to be working to close this unacceptable pay gap once and for all. pic.twitter.com/lB5UxZSfbj

#Trump's @EPA is trying to roll back our nation’s air quality standards to help big corporations make more money, while putting our health at risk. That’s not right. And that's why I am working with my @EnergyCommerce colleagues to hold them accountable. https://bit.ly/2CTAS7o

Just sent a letter to the head of @EPA demanding info about the Trump administration’s plan to roll back air-quality standards. We’re not going to sit back and let this administration put Americans’ health at risk just so companies can make more money.  https://degette.house.gov/sites/degette.house.gov/files/EPA.2019.1.28.%20Letter%20re%20EPA%20Air%20Rollbacks.EE_.OI_.pdf …

New @USCBO report shows the #shutdown caused $3 billion in permanent damage to our economy. But no number can quantify the suffering it caused to so many hardworking families. For the sake of our country and economy, we must never allow another crisis like this to happen again. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1089901758577602561 …

The effects of this awful #shutdown will be felt long after our government is reopened, especially for federal employees and contractors living paycheck to paycheck. Financial institutions need to show patience, and we must work to ensure they all receive the pay they’re due.

Check out my latest e-newsletter recapping some of this week’s important developments, including the agreement just reached to reopen the federal government. https://iqconnect.lmhostediq.com/iqextranet/view_newsletter.aspx?id=157993&c=CO01DD …

This government shutdown should never have happened. We need to work quickly to get the government reopened and ensure every federal worker is paid the money they are due. Then we need to work to make sure another crisis like this never happens again. pic.twitter.com/otoUFZuL43

Excited to announce that in addition to serving on @EnergyCommerce this Congress, I'll also serve on the House Natural Resources Committee. This gives us a great opportunity to keep working to protect CO’s environment & public lands for future generations.  https://bit.ly/2B50qym  pic.twitter.com/vg5XOC8w5Y

Americans are hurting, Mr. President. Enough is enough. We need to end the shutdown now. Then, work with Congress to find real solutions to enhance our border security. Coloradans, and all Americans, deserve leadership - not a tantrum.
I support enhancing our border security, but we need to have a real conversation about it instead of this “my way or the highway” approach President Trump is stuck on.

The House has voted multiple times to reopen the government, but President #Trump and Senate Republicans refuse to end this shutdown. They are holding our government and economy hostage for a ridiculous wall. The American people deserve better. We need to end the #shutdown now.

This is a devastating blow in the fight for #equality. I've been working to oppose this unjust policy from the beginning, and, despite this setback, we won't quit now. This is about legitimizing #trans Americans' inherent value -- in our military and our society at large. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1087727308411203584 …

As we recall both events this week, we're reminded that for every victory affirming and protecting our #reprorights, there is an effort to suppress them. With so much at stake, we can't let up the fight to defend women's health, and I'll lead the way. @ProChoiceCaucus #Roe46 pic.twitter.com/f2wNtEaePl

Today is the 46th anniversary of the #RoevWade decision, establishing American women's constitutional right to choose. But tomorrow also marks two year's since President Trump reinstated the anti-choice Global Gag Rule, threatening that right for women around the world.

It was a joy to once again participate in Denver’s annual #Marade, where we came together to honor Dr. King’s enduring legacy. His spirit is alive and well in our community, and we must continue working to fully realize his ideals across America and around the world. #MLKDay pic.twitter.com/i4qCb5exiR

Happy #MLKDay! As we honor this civil rights icon, let's also recommit ourselves to serving our community and advancing the fight for equality. We're not there yet, but we can get closer if we remain united by Dr. King’s timeless ideals. pic.twitter.com/nD1gX4qIQ2
First and foremost, he needs to end this shutdown immediately and then work with Congress on smart and effective border security methods that work.
The president’s address shows he continues to have no problem using people’s lives and livelihoods as a bargaining chip for his dangerous agenda.

In this week's e-newsletter, I recap the latest, including continuing my efforts to reopen the government, sharing my new leadership role on @EnergyCommerce, protecting our #ReproRights, and honoring the life and legacy of Dr. King ahead of #MLKDay. https://bit.ly/2AML29V

Thanks to the @nytimes for its stunning profile of nearly every woman in the 116th Congress. It's in newsstands today, and the stunning spread masterfully visualizes the strength of our growing numbers. Republican and Democrat, we remain united by a powerful sisterhood. pic.twitter.com/IEdEVvhOsP

"When DeGette assumes leadership of @EnergyCommerce's oversight and investigations panel, she pledged to use her gavel power to schedule #reprohealth hearings rooted in facts, not the anti-abortion fiction that the GOP-controlled committee previously enabled with taxpayer money." https://twitter.com/damemagazine/status/1085924864840495105 …

#GunViolence is one of the biggest public health crises facing our nation, and it's outrageous that our agencies aren't conducting more research on it. I've long supported this effort because it's an important step to saving lives. https://twitter.com/RepMaloney/status/1086021681540485120 …

New @OIGatHHS report found there may have been thousands more children separated from their families at the border than previously reported – and that the real number may never be known. That’s unacceptable! My subcommittee is working hard to investigate. https://bit.ly/2VZP2gf

We know the state of our union right now: It’s closed. @SpeakerPelosi is right to prevent Trump from giving a State of the Union address until after the government is re-opened. His first and only priority should be working with Congress to end this harmful #shutdown.

DeGette said the pro-choice majority in the House was historic. “I can’t tell you what this means for protecting the full range of women’s health,” said DeGette. “Not just here in the United States but around the world.” @ProChoiceCaucus https://bit.ly/2ClxYYQ
Today, one year later, I presided over the House floor and there wasn’t one anti-choice bill in sight. Elections have consequences! pic.twitter.com/zczywkAycI

This time last year, I was fighting hard against a draconian, anti-choice bill House Republicans were pushing ahead of the March for Life. For at least the last 5 years, House Republicans voted on these types of bills ahead of the march.

I'm proud to cosponsor the #RaiseTheWage Act, which increases the minimum wage to $15 an hour by 2024. As the ultra-rich get richer, working families have an increasingly tough time making ends meet; that's not right. it's time we ensure a livable wage for every American worker. pic.twitter.com/ODA9dQ3RAH

Two gavels in two days? What a week! Tune in to @cspan beginning at noon ET (10 am MT)  to watch me preside over the House floor throughout the day, or stream it live here:  https://www.c-span.org/congress/

From #Trump's tragic #FamilySeparation policy at the border, to #climatechange, to making health care more affordable, and more, our subcommittee has a lot to cover in this Congress. I'm honored to lead that effort on behalf of all Americans who rightfully demand good governance.

I’m pleased to announce that I’ve been named the chair of @EnergyCommerce’s Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee. Having the gavel on this important panel means greater power to investigate critical issues facing Americans and hold the #Trump administration accountable. pic.twitter.com/vYrYuRtccK

Justice strikes again. #Trump's attempt to add a question about citizenship on next year's Census was nothing more than a thinly-veiled attempt to deny immigrant communities fair representation in Congress. We must continue to fight this dangerous effort. https://cnb.cx/2FrQwLa
